New Records: Jaylen Brown became the fourth player in franchise history to have at least 40 points and at least four steals in a regular-season game.
Key Match Events: Jaylen Brown scored a season-high 44 points in Boston's 142-105 victory over Indiana.
The Celtics scored 142 points, the most given up by the Pacers in a game this season.
Pre-Game Insights: Jaylen Brown and the Boston Celtics will attempt to beat the visiting Indiana Pacers at home for the second time in three nights.
Sunday's matchup will be the third and final game between the teams during the regular season. Indiana won the first meeting 135-132 in overtime on Oct. 30.
Post-Match Reflections: Jaylen Brown expressed his pride in his defensive efforts, stating he feels like one of the best two-way players in the world.
Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton reflected on the lack of stops and poor shooting as key issues in their loss.
Indiana head coach Rick Carlisle emphasized the need for better performance in their next game against Boston.
